actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 102-745.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 431.
Mr. Gibbons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to the treatment of deposits under certain perpetual insurance policies.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude a deposit made by a policyholder under a qualified perpetual insurance policy from provisions governing the treatment of loans with below-market interest rates. Describes such a policy as one: (1) which provides insurance for property damage or casualty with respect to certain residential property (or the contents thereof); and (2) which is funded only by the policyholder placing a cash deposit (and does not provide for any periodic premiums) and such deposit is fully refundable upon cancellation.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to the treatment of deposits under certain perpetual insurance policies.
